thread.title: Copper Extends Slide on Swelling Inventories

author: David Hodari
title: Copper Extends Slide on Swelling Inventories
text:
Copper prices fell for the fourth straight session Friday, as swelling inventories pushed the base metal to its worst week since November 2014 and its lowest close since mid-December.
Front-month copper for February delivery declined 1.5%, to $3.0245 a pound, on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices are 8% off their four-year highs hit in late December, and have gotten hit hard this week with stocks and other risk assets falling and a rise in inventories around the world.
